intro: Nicolasia quinqueseta, commonly known as the five-leaved rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically five-lobed, giving it the species name "quinqueseta," which means "five-leaved" in Latin. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
